section.title: Bug reports, errors
section.p: This file is no longer in use. It was abandoned with the introduction of the bug report system Bugzilla. This file is kept since the bugs reported have not been migrated to Bugzilla.

section.title: Umlaut errors
section.p: The same error is recorded for gaerie. Look into this.

section.title: Trouble recognising ie...ie nouns
section.p: It seems it does not recognise ..ie..ie nouns. bielkie, biehkie, etc. Others work, e.g. jiekie !!??
The error could lie in the different encoding in the lexicon, cf. below. Perhaps we should have had "bE1hkI2", patterning with "jiekie".

section.title: Generating the illative
section.p: The generator gives us two illative suffixes for both bi- and trisyllables, in stead of the intended distribution. Thus, it generates both 'daktarasse' and '*daktarase', both 'maanese' and '*maanasse' (sic! note the errouneous -a- as well), both 'nï¿½jtese' and '*nï¿½jtasse'.

section.title: Final -e missing in inessive
section.p: The system gives inessives without the final -e. The maana nouns also lose their a/e alternation in the stem vowel.

section.title: Errors in the 2nd person personal pronoun
section.p: Have a look at the -nn- vs, -tn- alternation, it seems to be not ok.
